text:
With all clients it's important to ensure there's a clear project scope and ensure you and the client are aligned on what will be delivered.

In the case of content, I generally have clients provide examples of content they like in addition to their competitors and their general information questions.

Based on that I'm able to provide a relatively clear vision up front to the client, so if there isn't alignment, it's caught early on.

The other thing to consider is billing. Hourly, per word, flat rate, hybrid? When you're just starting out and even when experienced, it can be hard to estimate timelines to do a flat rate bid.

For many of my projects I bill hourly, but those are with larger companies. For small businesses, quite often I'll bill hourly for interviews/discussions and then for the content, bill per word.
